examples.sentence: Use with close friends/family more freely
Add softeners like んです、と思う in formal situations
Consider more indirect patterns with superiors

sections.heading: What is 〜てほしい (te-hoshii)?
sections.content:
〜てほしい expresses that you want someone to do something. It combines the te-form of a verb with ほしい to show your desire for another person's action.

[Verb te-form] + ほしい 来てほしい "I want (you/them) to come" 手伝ってほしい "I want (you/them) to help"

children.heading: Basic Pattern
children.content: Verb (te-form) + ほしい Plain: 〜てほしい Polite: 〜てほしいです 来る → 来て → 来てほしい / 来てほしいです "want (someone) to come" 手伝う → 手伝って → 手伝ってほしい "want (someone) to help"

children.heading: Want Someone to Do
children.content:
Expresses your desire for another person to perform an action.

静かにしてほしい "I want (you) to be quiet" 説明してほしい "I want (you) to explain" 待ってほしい "I want (you) to wait"

children.heading: に Marks the Person
children.content:
The person you want to do something is marked with に.

友達に来てほしい "I want my friend to come" 彼に手伝ってほしい "I want him to help" 先生に教えてほしい "I want the teacher to teach (me)"

children.heading: Omitting the Person
children.content:
When context is clear, the person is often omitted:

来てほしい "I want (you) to come" 手伝ってほしい "I want (you) to help" わかってほしい "I want (you) to understand"

sections.heading: Conjugation
sections.content: Like ほしい, てほしい conjugates as an i-adjective.

children.heading: Present Affirmative
children.content: 来てほしい / 来てほしいです "want (someone) to come" 手伝ってほしい / 手伝ってほしいです "want (someone) to help"

children.heading: Present Negative
children.content: 来てほしくない / 来てほしくないです "don't want (someone) to come" 手伝ってほしくない "don't want (someone) to help"

children.heading: Past Affirmative
children.content: 来てほしかった / 来てほしかったです "wanted (someone) to come" 手伝ってほしかった "wanted (someone) to help"

children.heading: Past Negative
children.content: 来てほしくなかった / 来てほしくなかったです "didn't want (someone) to come" 手伝ってほしくなかった "didn't want (someone) to help"

children.heading: 〜てほしいんです (explanatory)
children.content: 手伝ってほしいんです "The thing is, I want you to help" 来てほしいんですが "I want you to come (but...)"

children.heading: 〜てほしいと思う (I think I want)
children.content:
Softens the request.

来てほしいと思います "I think I want you to come" 手伝ってほしいと思っている "I'm thinking I want you to help"

children.heading: 〜てほしかった (wanted someone to)
children.content:
Expressing past desires.

来てほしかった "I wanted you to come" わかってほしかった "I wanted you to understand"

children.heading: Direct but Personal
children.content:
てほしい is more personal than ください but less direct than commands.

More formal: 手伝ってください "Please help" Personal: 手伝ってほしい "I want you to help" Direct command: 手伝って "Help"

children.heading: Polite Requests
children.content:
Add です or combine with other patterns:

手伝ってほしいです "I want you to help" (polite) 手伝ってほしいんですが "I want you to help (softened)" 手伝ってほしいと思うんですが "I think I want you to help (very soft)"

children.heading: Example 1: Asking for Help
children.content: A: どうしたの？ "What's wrong?" B: ちょっと手伝ってほしいんだけど "I want you to help me a bit" A: いいよ、何？ "Sure, what?" B: この荷物を持ってほしい "I want you to carry this luggage"

children.heading: Example 2: Making a Wish
children.content: A: 誕生日、何かほしい？ "Do you want anything for your birthday?" B: パーティーをしてほしい "I want you to throw a party" A: いいね！計画しよう "Nice! Let's plan it"

children.heading: Example 3: Expressing Feelings
children.content: A: 彼女、怒ってるね "She's angry" B: うん、わかってほしかったんだと思う "Yeah, I think she wanted me to understand" A: 話してみたら？ "Why don't you try talking to her?"

sections.heading: Common Verbs with てほしい

children.heading: Communication
children.content: わかってほしい - want (someone) to understand 聞いてほしい - want (someone) to listen 話してほしい - want (someone) to talk 教えてほしい - want (someone) to teach 説明してほしい - want (someone) to explain

children.heading: Actions
children.content: 来てほしい - want (someone) to come 行ってほしい - want (someone) to go 手伝ってほしい - want (someone) to help 待ってほしい - want (someone) to wait やってほしい - want (someone) to do

children.heading: States
children.content: いてほしい - want (someone) to be there 信じてほしい - want (someone) to believe 覚えてほしい - want (someone) to remember 考えてほしい - want (someone) to think about

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong particle for person
children.content: Wrong: 友達を来てほしい ❌ Right: 友達に来てほしい ✓ "I want my friend to come"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using plain ほしい with actions
children.content: Wrong: 手伝うがほしい ❌ Right: 手伝ってほしい ✓ "I want (you) to help" Plain ほしい is for objects: お金がほしい ✓ "I want money"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with たい
children.content: Wrong: 彼に行きたい ❌ Right: 彼に行ってほしい ✓ "I want him to go" Or if you want to go with him: 彼と行きたい ✓ "I want to go with him"

children.heading: Don't Want Someone To
children.content: 来てほしくない "I don't want (you) to come" 知ってほしくない "I don't want (you) to know" 心配してほしくない "I don't want (you) to worry" 忘れてほしくない "I don't want (you) to forget"

children.heading: どうしても〜てほしい (want no matter what)
children.content: どうしても来てほしい "I want you to come no matter what" どうしてもわかってほしい "I want you to understand no matter what"

children.heading: 〜てほしいだけ (just want)
children.content: わかってほしいだけ "I just want you to understand" 聞いてほしいだけ "I just want you to listen"

children.heading: 〜てほしくてたまらない (want so badly)
children.content: 会ってほしくてたまらない "I want to see you so badly" わかってほしくてたまらない "I want you to understand so badly"

children.heading: Personal Wishes
children.content: 幸せでいてほしい "I want you to be happy" 元気でいてほしい "I want you to stay healthy" そばにいてほしい "I want you to stay by my side" 忘れないでほしい "I want you to not forget"

children.heading: For Others' Wellbeing
children.content: 無理しないでほしい "I don't want you to push yourself" 気をつけてほしい "I want you to be careful" 頑張ってほしい "I want you to do your best"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 来てほしい "I want you to come" 手伝ってほしくない "I don't want you to help"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 来てほしいです "I want you to come" 手伝ってほしいんですが "I want you to help (but...)"

children.heading: Very Polite/Indirect
children.content: 来ていただきたいんですが "I would like you to come (humble)" お手伝いいただけますか "Could you help?" (indirect request)

children.heading: 〜てほしかったら (if you want someone to)
children.content: 来てほしかったら、電話して "If you want me to come, call me" 手伝ってほしかったら、言ってね "If you want me to help, tell me"

children.heading: 〜てほしければ (if you want)
children.content: わかってほしければ、説明して "If you want me to understand, explain"

children.heading: てほしい vs てください
children.content: てほしい: Personal desire 手伝ってほしい "I want you to help" (personal feeling) てください: Request 手伝ってください "Please help" (polite request)

children.heading: てほしい vs たい
children.content: てほしい: Want someone else to do 来てほしい "I want you to come" たい: Want to do yourself 行きたい "I want to go"

children.heading: Expressing Desires
children.content:
In Japanese culture, directly expressing what you want from others can be considered forward. てほしい is relatively direct, so:

Use with close friends/family more freely Add softeners like んです、と思う in formal situations Consider more indirect patterns with superiors

children.heading: Implying Requests
children.content:
Sometimes てほしい implies a request rather than just stating a wish:

手伝ってほしいんだけど "I want you to help (so will you?)"

children.heading: Basic Wishes
children.content: 来てほしい "I want you to come" わかってほしい "I want you to understand" 信じてほしい "I want you to believe (me)" 待ってほしい "I want you to wait"

children.heading: With Person Marked
children.content: 友達に来てほしい "I want my friend to come" 彼に手伝ってほしい "I want him to help" 先生に教えてほしい "I want the teacher to teach (me)"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 来てほしくない "I don't want you to come" 心配してほしくない "I don't want you to worry" 知ってほしくない "I don't want you to know"

children.heading: Past
children.content: 来てほしかった "I wanted you to come" わかってほしかった "I wanted you to understand" そばにいてほしかった "I wanted you to be by my side"

children.heading: Softened Requests
children.content: ちょっと手伝ってほしいんだけど "I want you to help me a bit" 説明してほしいんですが "I want you to explain (but...)" 来てほしいと思うんです "I think I want you to come"

children.heading: Wellbeing Wishes
children.content: 幸せでいてほしい "I want you to be happy" 元気でいてほしい "I want you to stay healthy" 無理しないでほしい "I don't want you to push yourself" 笑っていてほしい "I want you to keep smiling"
